In order to curb piracy, the legal release of the film 3 Idiots was planned for 25 March 2010 on YouTube. This made it the first Indian film to have a legal release on this platform for those who cannot afford theatre tickets. However, due to copyright issues, the release did not happen as planned and it became available on YouTube in May 2012, but its access has since been restricted.

Upon release, the film 3 Idiots received widespread critical acclaim from both domestic and international critics. Praise was directed towards its direction, themes, humour, story, screenplay, soundtrack, and performances of the cast.
Subhash K. Jha stated that while 3 Idiots is not a completely flawless work of art, it still falls under the category of contemporary art.

node_1: vital and inspiring work of contemporary art
edge: Subhash K. Jha further stated that although 3 Idiots is not perfect, it still holds significant importance and has the power to revolutionize one's life.

Subhash K. Jha suggested that although cinema cannot save lives, it can at least instill hope and make people believe that life is worth living, especially in a country where students are often driven to suicide by their demanding curriculum.
The director of 3 Idiots takes the definition of entertainment into directions of social comment, as stated by Subhash K. Jha.
Subhash K. Jha also pointed out that the director of 3 Idiots follows a simplistic 'humanism alone works' philosophy, which he had carried forward from his Munnabhai series.
According to Nikhat Kazmi of The Times of India, the film 3 Idiots is a laugh riot despite being high on fundas.
Kazmi also stated that Hirani carries forward his simplistic 'humanism alone works' philosophy of the Munnabhai series in 3 Idiots, making it a signature tune to 2009.
Kazmi further noted that although the second half of the film does falter in some parts, especially during the childbirth sequence, it doesn't take long for the movie to get back on track.

Mayank Shekhar of the Hindustan Times gave the film three and a half out of five stars and comments that "this is the sort of movie you'll take home with a smile and a song on your lips." Aamir is the lead actor in the film.
Directed by Rajkumar Hirani, 3 Idiots received four and a half out of five stars from Taran Adarsh of Bollywood Hungama.
Produced by Vidhu Vinod Chopra, 3 Idiots is one of the finest films created by him along with Aamir and Rajkumar Hirani.

Kaveree Bamzai of India Today gave 3 Idiots five stars and stated that "it's a lovely story, of a man from nowhere who wanted to learn told like a fairy tale, with the secret heart carrying its coded message of setting all of us free."

Taran Adarsh of Bollywood Hungama gave 3 Idiots four and a half out of five stars and argued that "on the whole, 3 idiots easily ranks amongst Aamir, Rajkumar Hirani and Vidhu Vinod Chopra's finest films. Do yourself and your family a favor: watch 3 idiots. It's emotional, it's entertaining, it's enlightening. The film has tremendous youth appeal and feel-good factor to work in a big way."

The film's popularity, particularly in South Korea, can be traced back to the national background of the overly competitive education system.
In Korea, students of all ages – from young elementary children to university graduate students – are trained to study under overwhelming pressure and extremely high academic standards.

In 2013, Hollywood filmmaker Steven Spielberg praised Indian Hindi-language comedy-drama film 3 Idiots, which he had seen three times and said he 'loved the emotional undertones.' He listed it as one of five films that he connects with, along with The Godfather (1972) and his own work on E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982), Saving Private Ryan (1998) and Jaws (1975).

The film '3 Idiots' is based on the novel '5 Point Someone' by Chetan Bhagat. The makers officially credited the film as 'Based on a novel by Chetan Bhagat.'
The core theme and message of the film '3 Idiots' are coming from the novel '5 Point Someone' by Chetan Bhagat.

Chetan Bhagat, explaining about the novel's connection with the film, in an interview a day after its release. The controversy developed a few days after the release over the fact that Chetan's credit, 'Based on the novel Five Point Someone by Chetan Bhagat' appeared in the closing credits rather than in the opening ones. At that time, Bhagat stated that he 'was expecting an opening credit and I was quite surprised on not seeing it.'
In a 31 December 2009 blog post on his personal website, Bhagat stated that he was told the movie was only 2–5% based on the book, but when he saw it, he felt that it was 70% of the book.

Bhagat argued that he was misled by the makers of the film, though he noted, that 'this has nothing to do with Mr. Aamir Khan […] I am a big fan of Aamir and he has made my story reach people. However, he was told by the makers not to read the book, and he hasn't. Thus, he cannot comment on the issue in a meaningful manner.'

According to reports, Chetan Bhagat claimed that the producer Vidhu Vinod Chopra 'lost his cool' and asked a reporter to shut up when questioned whether the movie 3 Idiots was lifted from his book Five Point Someone. However, the producers of the film clarified that they had officially bought the rights for the film, drawn a contract with Bhagat, and clearly mentioned the position of his credit in it. The producers also stated that they hadn't changed the font size or increased the speed of the title, and it was exactly where it was agreed to be in the contract.

Chetan Bhagat claimed that Vidhu Vinod Chopra 'lost his cool' and asked a reporter to shut up when questioned whether the producer had lifted the story of his book Five Point Someone for the movie 3 Idiots. However, Chopra later apologized for his behavior, stating that he was provoked but shouldn't have done this.

According to reports, Chetan Bhagat claimed that Vidhu Vinod Chopra, the producer of 3 Idiots, clarified through the Indo-Asian News Service (IANS) that in the agreement between the producer and Bhagat, it was clearly mentioned that the author's name would be put in the closing credits.

In January 2016, Raju Hirani and Aamir Khan confirmed that they were considering a 3 Idiots sequel. Hirani expressed his strong desire to make the sequel during an interview promoting Sanju in June 2018.
In January 2016, Aamir Khan hinted at the possibility of a 3 Idiots sequel during an interview with reporters.
In June 2018, while promoting Sanju, Raju Hirani was asked about the possibility of a Munna Bhai sequel. He stated that work on the sequel will begin after he finishes working on the 3 Idiots sequel.
